About Us
SnapTravel is a conversational commerce startup, allowing millions of users around the world to book their travel over messaging.
With a high-performing team of world class leaders, SnapTravel thrives on tackling complex problems within NLP (understanding and replying to ambiguous human messaging), Conversational Commerce (optimizing conversions and user behavior over chat) and Machine Learning (choosing the best hotel automatically from a large data set with complex market dynamics) to push the boundaries of tech and travel globally.

At SnapTravel, we pride ourselves on the performance-driven environment we’ve created for our team to prosper and excel. Our values are rooted in making data driven-decisions and risk-taking actions that add value to both the user and the team.

About the Role
We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our growing Data Analytics team! As a Sr. Data Analyst at SnapTravel, you will be responsible for using data to answer strategic questions and drive our business strategy and vigorous growth. With a strong analytical and data-driven approach, you are an expert in quantitative analysis and will use your skills to help our team organize, visualize and understand large data sets relating to various marketing channels. This is an exciting opportunity to take ownership in a role as you run deep-dive analyses, create regression models, build dashboards and reporting to drive business growth and draw strategic insights from product and user data.
Key Challenges
Data-driven Culture: you will be an ambassador for our data-driven culture, taking data and using it to answer business questions and drive strategy & decision making
Data Management: you will access, clean and organize raw data in a way that makes sense for both you and the team.
Project Management: you will lead data projects from start to finish, showing your ability to manage scope, work with ambiguity
Visualizations: you will help us to see and understand our data in a way that makes sense, creating automated dashboards and funnels for various internal teams
Collaborative Execution: You will liaise between Business & Engineering leads across the organization to translate your technical insights into a condensed understandable format
Business Strategy: your quantitative analysis will be an integral part of helping us to answer the toughest questions in our business, such as: Where in the product and marketing funnels should we concentrate our efforts and our spend? Where can we improve the most? What key insights can be drawn from our users and the way that they use our product? What is the best way to segment and track our users and data? What can we learn through cohort analyses, regression models, etc? What A/B tests, experiments and multivariate product tests can be used to explore new ideas, and how can they be effectively tracked, measured and monitored? When are the results statistically significant? When do we pull the plug?
About You
You are outstanding at pulling, cleaning and manipulating large sets of complex data to turn them into stories that key stakeholders can understand
You are an expert at writing SQL queries & doing data analysis with Python and/or R, and know your way around visualization tools (Tableau, Periscope, etc.)
You are naturally curious, and have a solid understanding of common statistical methods and their real-world applications
You are a problem solver with strong project management skills who can ruthlessly prioritize different business initiatives
Experience running multivariate product tests and growth experiments is a major plus!

Creative Destruction Lab (CDL) is an objectives-based program for massively scalable, seed-stage science- and technology-based companies. The program's objective-setting process enhances the performance of technical founders who learn from the insights of experienced entrepreneurs, increasing their probability of success.

Founded in 2012 at the Rotman School of Management at the University of Toronto, the program has now expanded with locations in Vancouver, Calgary, Montreal, Halifax, Oxford, Paris, and Atlanta. Since its inception, companies that have participated in the CDL program have created more than $5.8 billion (CAD) in equity value.

Job Description
One of Networkers clients in the Payments and ECommerce industry is looking for a Data Engineer to join their fast evolving team on a fulltime basis in downtown Toronto.

If working with billions of events, petabytes of data and optimizing for last millisecond is something that excites you then read on! We are looking for Data Engineers who have seen their fair share of messy data sets and have been able to structure them for building useful AI products.

You will be working on writing frameworks building for real time and batch pipelines to ingest and transform events(108scale) from 100’s of applications every day. Our ML and Software engineers consume these for building data products like personalization and fraud detection. You will also help optimize the feature pipelines for fast execution and work with software engineers to build event driven microservices.

You will get to put cutting edge tech in production and freedom to experiment with new frameworks, try new ways to optimize and resources to build next big thing in fintech using data!

Requirements

· You have previously worked on building serious data pipelines ingesting and transforming > 10 ^6 events per minute and terabytes of data per day.

· You are passionate about producing clean, maintainable and testable code part of real-time data pipeline.

· You understand how microservices work and are familiar with concepts of data modeling.

· You can connect different services and processes together even if you have not worked with them before and follow the flow of data through various pipelines to debug data issues.

· You have worked with Spark and Kafka before and have experimented or heard about Flink/Druid/Ignite/Presto/Athena and understand when to use one over the other.

· On a bad day maintaining zookeeper and bringing up cluster doesn’t bother you.

· You may not be a networking expert but you understand issues with ingesting data from applications in multiple data centres across geographies, on-premise and cloud and will find a way to solve them.

· Proficient in Java/Scala/Python/Spark

Our products and services move, treat, analyze, monitor and return water to the environment, in public utility, industrial, residential and commercial building services settings. Overview:
The Data Analyst will provide accurate analysis and reporting of the data collected with Pure Technologies, a Xylem brand, innovative pipeline inspection platforms that is of utmost importance to the owners of water and wastewater civil infrastructure. The Data Analyst will maintain responsibility for the analysis of electromagnetic and ultrasonic data utilizing various state of the art proprietary software and techniques. This position requires a highly motivated individual who will provide our customers with critical information on the condition of their infrastructure.

Essential Duties/Principal Responsibilities:
Interpret pipeline engineering drawings and correlate with electromagnetic and ultrasonic data.

Use electromagnetic data to identify pipes with defects related to broken wire wraps within pipelines.
Use ultrasonic data to identify and locate areas of pipe wall thinning.
Produce technical reports based on the analysis of an electromagnetic and ultrasonic data inspection of a pipeline.
Work closely with project team to: understand the full scope of a project, obtain all required project information and deadlines, and resolve any concerns or problems with the inspection data.
May be required to assist with field inspections, on-site analysis and presentation of results to clients.
Occasional travel throughout North America may be required.

Minimum Qualifications: Education, Experience, Skills, Abilities, License/Certifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Physics or Engineering from an accredited university.
Strong understanding of the physical sciences.
Methodical and analytical with problem-solving situations.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
Customer relation skills when dealing with project inquiries.
Ability to work well both independently and as part of a team.
General pipeline knowledge or experience an asset.
Knowledge and application of artificial intelligence systems desirable.
Knowledge of computer programming (Python, SQL, MATLAB, C++, VBA) and data science methods desirable.
High level of computer literacy.

Preferred Qualifications:
An aptitude for pattern recognition and attention to detail and high degree of accuracy.
Time management skills and an ability to prioritize various tasks to meet strict deadlines.
Experience in non-destructive testing data collection and data analysis desirable.

Physical Demands: Light duty, occasional assistance in field work

Work Environment: Office

At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experience, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. From our office in Downtown Toronto, we’ve created leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started.

The impact you'll make
In this role, you would be a part of the Quantitative Research team whose mandate is to create programs which surface the voice of our customers across the business, uncovering friction and high points in our experience. You will be active in building a human-centered culture.

In this role you will work directly with colleagues across multiple functions (Product Management, Product Design, Engineering, Marketing, Leadership) to use our continuous Voice of Customer programs and other insight tools to provide deep, actionable insights which can inform our business strategy, roadmaps and designs.

You will lead a team of analysts to deliver insight and have continual impact in the business. You will also partner with other human-centered practices, in particular Design Research to deliver holistic research and insight projects. You will be comfortable synthesising insights from a variety of sources and to deliver them in a variety of mediums (for example journey maps, immersion sessions, presentations, workshops).

We’re excited for you to join us on our journey.
What you'll do
Identify, intake and prioritize research opportunities in collaboration with business operators. Owning the process of both proactively spotting friction in our customers’ experience but also receiving input from colleagues.
Frame research hypotheses and questions to ideate on research approaches that address these problems. You will select appropriate methodologies and lead the planning of the end-to-end process.
Conduct the end-to-end research process including recruitment, activity/discussion guide preparation and facilitation of a broad range of research methods which can address a user (including interviews, ethnography, diary studies, remote research methods, co-creation, surveys, experiments).
Collaborate closely with insight analysts or other practices to utilize data from available sources, including transactional survey feedback, behavioral data, secondary research.
Synthesize data and create actionable recommendations through collaboration with key partners that you’ve identified across the disciplines. Document and present research in a variety of compelling artifacts/mediums (including immersion sessions, presentations, workshops).
Drive action through from research; working closely with the Product Designers (within your business) to lead ideation sessions and continually build relationships with your key partners.
Contribute to building our research practice through thought leadership, processes, developing educational content and continually learning about new approaches in our industry.
Does this sound like you?
5+ years’ experience in a research or insight role, analysing and integrating research into the design of experiences and propositions
A university degree in an analytical discipline or a human-centered discipline (Psychology, Sociology, Anthropology, Human Computer Interaction, Interaction or Experience Design)
Demonstrated understanding of the strengths and shortcomings of different research methods, including qualitative, including when and how to apply them during product development processes and apply them to strategy
By definition you are collaborative. On any engagement you work to identify who you should partner with and ensure you actively bring your partners on your journey.
You are open to being flexible in your approaches, particularly in circumstances where you only have time for ‘just enough’ research.
Project leadership or line management experience
Experience working with large scale data in multi-method studies;
Knowledge of user-centered design methods;
Experience prioritizing time between multiple projects and managing projects involving cross-functional disciplines.

Bonus Qualifications:
Experience in product, service or UX design
Passion for emerging tech and trends in one or more of the: grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, and apparel spaces.
At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce.
You will get to work with some of the best digital minds and will have the support of world class technologies to craft products our customers will love!

Loblaw Digital recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired.
In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

Data is a big deal at Index Exchange. Our advertising exchange generates multiple terabytes of auction-related information each day and our Data Engineering team builds tools and infrastructure to help manage this vast amount of data. Working within our larger R&D team, our Data Engineers use a specialized suite of tech and hardware to pipe, parse and maintain our data, including the oversight of a multi-petabyte cluster. We're looking for Engineers to join our team and help build the next generation of big data solutions at Index Exchange.

Working on the bleeding edge of exciting technology, you're afforded the opportunity to experiment with new tools and attempt radically different approaches than traditional software engineering affords. Every day with the Data team is different and each project presents its own set of new and exciting challenges. Things shift very quickly in our industry and we rely on the Data team to keep us ahead of the curve and moving in the right direction.

Here's what we want:
Problem Solver: You are curious and loves exploring multiple approaches to find the most efficient, scalable solution and solve a problem
Collaborative: You work well with other people
Passionate: A passion for Big Data and an interest in the latest trends and developments constantly researching new tools and data technologies
Self-starter: You are comfortable helping your team get things done
Here's what you'll be doing:
Design, implement, and maintain data pipelines for extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources to various data services
Identify, design, and implement system performance improvements
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements
Automate manual processes and optimize data delivery
Useful skills/background:

You may or may not tick off every box, and that's ok. Each person brings a different background and different skills. If you think you are a good match for what we are looking for tell us why, and tell us what you are doing to improve yourself and we'll see what we can do to help!
A degree in Computer Science/Engineering or related field
2-4 years of experience in a software engineering environment
Experience with SQL and NoSQL systems
Knowledge of Hadoop, Spark, Kafka or other equivalent technologies
Proficiency in some of the following languages: Scala, Java, Python, Bash
Experience with automated testing systems
Mentorship, collaboration, and communication skills
Knowledge of data modelling, data warehousing, ETL processes, and business intelligence reporting tools
Experience working with CI/CD, containerization, and virtualization tools such as Gitlab, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Docker
Why you'll love working here:
Office space in the vibrant downtown core, located near the new transit hub for GO Transit and GRT buses
Our offices speak to who we are: no walls or cubicles - wide-open spaces where we can freely communicate and collaborate
We don't have a dress code and we offer flexible work hours
A solid work-life balance
Free snacks and drinks, with catered lunches every day
Annual celebrations (Summer BBQ, Holiday Party, All Hands, Hack Days) and milestone outings
100% coverage for family health and dental benefits, RRSP matching, and a $5 Goodlife memberships

Summary:
Machine learning and Artificial Intelligence (ML and AI) is a strategic initiative in risk management. The candidate will participate in new projects and be hands-on along side internal experts. The candidate will have a concrete and meaningful contribution to the final deliverables and is expect to show autonomy and ownership of their deliverables.

The candidate will be responsible for identifying AI and ML use cases in the Risk Capital and Model Development group and building these models in partnership with the existing team. This will cover multiple areas such as Anti-Money Laundering, Credit Risk, Economic Capital etc.

The candidate will also be working on identifying automation opportunities where existing processes can be enhanced and simplified using AI.

The role also has a technology component where the candidate will participate in the assessment of the current risk technology stack and test and validate assumptions on new tools.

Description:

Use case identification:

Expand on the currently identified use cases by partnering with the existing model development groups and the business partners and identify other types of models/applications where ML and AI can add value. This will cover areas such as credit risk, economic capital, AML and market risk.
Structure above identified use cases, define operating model, manage delivery and provide
Data collection and manipulation
Collect data for model development purposes by identifying new candidate variables and predictive variables.
Analyze and summarize data to identify outliers and assess data quality.
Perform data imputation using advanced statistical techniques (multiple imputation, machine learning estimations).
Transform and prepare the data for developing AI models.
Predictive models development
Fully understand the existing version of the models where applicable, their limitations and all the underlying assumptions made.
Use the prepared data to build machine learning predictive models using advanced regression techniques such as random forests, neural networks, boosted trees, deep learning, logistic regressions, NLP etc
Rank and compare the candidate models to select the best fitting models.
Use statistical tests to ensure the stability and robustness of the candidate models.
Identify new opportunities to apply machine learning in the current model development process.
Reasonableness assessment
Ensure that the models developed make business and intuitive sense by participating in sessions with the model owners, lines of businesses and including their feedback in the model.
Design a process to explain the output of the models on a consistent basis to understand why the models are producing these decisions.
Documentation

Employer: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health
descrip:
Job Number: 856473

Category: Acute Care

Positions Available: 1

Years Experience Required: 2

Location: Toronto, Ontario

Posted Date: Mar 12, 2020

EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY

Project Scientist
Nicotine Dependence Service
Acute Care

Position Description
The Nicotine Dependence Service (NDS) at the Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH) is seeking a full time, contract (1 year) Project Scientist, preferably a Clinical Psychologist, to lead and execute a set of research studies focused on novel and technology-mediated methods for behaviour change in populations with mental health and addictions diagnoses. Our team has developed a number of broad streams within our research program to discover and treat factors that impact smoking cessation, and the incumbent will have a strong familiarity and aptitude for working with technology solutions.

Other research streams within the NDS include projects in imaging, mechanisms of drug action, and novel treatment approaches, led by a quantitative scientist with expertise in clinical pharmacology; as well as projects in provider behavior change, knowledge synthesis, and knowledge translation, led by a qualitative scientist with expertise in developmental psychology. This academic team is augmented by a data scientist, directors of operations and education, and project managers. The interdisciplinary NDS team is led by a clinician-scientist, who is a Professor in the Faculty of Medicine at the University of Toronto. The successful candidate will report to the clinician-scientist for scientific/academic matters, and to the Director of Operations for administrative matters. The successful candidate will work collaboratively with all scientists and directors in the program.

This position is results-oriented. The primary duty of this role is to focus on studies and research ideas conceptualized by the clinician-scientist; however, there is the possibility of integrating clinical supervision to clinical and treatment trial staff for up to 20% of your time. The successful candidate will be expected to transform some already-conceptualized research ideas into testable hypotheses or measurable research questions, and to develop protocols and lead their execution. Many of these research projects will involve methods that include the application of technology solutions, web-based platform and human-computer interfaces. The candidate will be encouraged to bring forward new research ideas to propose to and seek endorsement from the clinician-scientist; however, any new ideas must be aligned with the overall goal of our research program.

The candidate may be expected to lead grant submissions in addition to supporting submissions led by others. The candidate will also be expected to produce peer-reviewed publications to disseminate findings from their activities. In fulfilling these requirements, the candidate must adhere to all regulatory requirements for conducting research on human subjects in Canada and work collaboratively with research ethics boards and research quality assurance departments. The candidate will be expected to supervise undergraduate students, support supervision of graduate students and post-doctoral fellows, and provide guidance to staff as need. The candidate will be supported should they wish to pursue a faculty appointment at the University of Toronto.

Qualifications
The candidate will have a PhD in Clinical Psychology with research interest in primary care, mental health, addictions and innovative applications of technology to advance the reach and effectiveness of care. Candidates without a degree in Clinical Psychology but doctoral work in a related field will also be considered. Candidates will be required to have a minimum of two years of direct experience in clinical research while holding a leading role. The candidate should have experience with producing peer-reviewed publications to disseminate findings from their activities. The successful candidate must have demonstrated academic and work experience in working effectively within interdisciplinary teams as well as independently, and in completing studies or projects on time. They will be a self-starter with strong logistical and organizational skills; and must be able to work on multiple projects simultaneously with exceptional accuracy and attention to detail. Good judgment and investigative skills to identify alternatives is essential to this role. Superior interpersonal, communication (oral/written) and organizational skills along with analytical and problem solving skills are a must. Preferred candidates will be new investigators, or investigators who want to return to academia. Having lived experience is an asset. Bilingualism (French/English) and/or proficiency in a second language would be an asset.

Please note: This full time, contract (1 year) position is NOT part of any bargaining unit.

Salary Range: Competitive Compensation and Benefits Package.

CAMH is a Tobacco-Free Organization.

CAMH is fully affiliated with the University of Toronto and is a teaching hospital and research institute. As a CAMH employee you will be expected to actively support CAMH’s teaching and research activities, in addition to supporting the clinical work of the hospital.

As an employment equity employer CAMH actively seeks Aboriginal peoples, visible minorities, women, people with disabilities, (including people with who have experienced mental health and substance use challenges), and additional diverse identities for our workforce.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If contacted for an interview, please inform us should accommodation be required.

The Data Science Hub is a new resource that serves as a focal point in the coordination for data science research support activities at the University of Toronto. The Data Science Hub will catalyze new forms of collaboration and interaction amongst researchers; and build capacity for data- and computational-based projects and training; and be a focal point for coordination of data science activities and partnerships.

Reporting to the Executive Director and working with senior staff in the Division of the Vice-President, Research & Innovation (DVPRI), and the Centre for Research & Innovation Support (CRIS), the Manager will engage in a range of activities and projects at a strategic level to engage and enhance existing and developing supports for data- and computationally-based research at the University of Toronto. CRIS is a joint initiative of the DVPRI, University of Toronto Libraries (UTL), and Information Technology Services (ITS) with a mandate to serve as a researcher-centric resource hub, amplifying access and visibility of all services, training, research tools and support expertise across the University.

The Manager, Data Science Hub provides strategic, tactical and highly professional leadership to advance the University’s academic mission, and in particular its commitment to research and innovation. The Manager serves as a trusted adviser and senior consultant to faculty members, and will advise on optimal supports, solutions, processes, ensuring that projects connect with university-wide and divisional tools and resources (SciNet, the Statistics Toronto Regional Data Centre, SOSCIP and UTL). The Manager collaborates with faculty, academic administrators, and divisional and university-wide research and innovation support units to:

Consult and understand data science research support needs at a strategic, institutional-wide level.
Establish and support new forms of collaboration and interaction amongst data science researchers
Develop and manage strong relationships with CRIS, and university-wide support units and the academic divisions that support data science resources.
Develop and recommend policies and/or guidelines related to research data management that have University-wide impacts.
Develop and maintain approaches to support the efficient and effective connection of researchers to university-wide and divisional research data science resources.
Optimize the use of existing research data and computational supports by providing training and communications, best use cases, and consolidating information, as well as instruction on their use through the Centre for Research & Innovation Support.
Work with the academic divisions, UTL, and ITS to support the direction to existing University data science and computational training, as well as support the creation of innovative training programs for faculty.

The incumbent is a member of the CRIS Advisory Committee, chaired by the Vice-President, Research & Innovation, and Strategic Partnerships, and participates in related working groups as well as strategic-level senior meetings including the DVPRI Research Advisory Board.

Qualifications:
(MINIMUM)

Education:
Post Graduate degree (Master’s or Ph.D.) in a data and/or computational science field or equivalent in education and experience. Ph.D. is strongly preferred.

Experience:
Eight (8) years related administrative experience at a senior level in a university or research focused institution; including experience working in an understanding of the university’s organizational structure. In-depth understanding of the post-secondary environment, the research and innovation landscape across the sciences, social sciences and humanities, and the provision of support for instructional technology. Demonstrated success with the implementation of new initiatives and processes; Demonstrated experience with program development, professional learning, service delivery and evaluation of those activities in a higher education context; proven effective leadership and participation in committee work.

Skills:
Strong leadership and staff management skills; superb research, writing, communication, presentation and interpersonal skills; high degree of political acuity and judgment, consensus building; ability to deal with senior University Officers in a manner which facilitates cooperation and consensus building; ability to work independently with a high degree of initiative, discretion, and tact; ability and willingness to work cooperatively in a challenging and dynamic environment; ability to work under pressure; superior organizational skills in planning, project management flexibility and problem solver orientation; excellent planning and supervisory skills; demonstrated ability to work with a constantly fluctuating workload and to meet deadlines; excellent writing ability and demonstrated ability to work with and gain the support of colleagues.

Other:
Ability to maintain strict confidentiality; high level of professionalism; demonstrated persuasion and negotiation skills. Superior ability to work independently and to be a strategic and creative thinker; Ability to manage a complex set of competing priorities.

The Data Science Hub is a new resource that serves as a focal point in the coordination for data science research support activities at the University of Toronto. The Data Science Hub will catalyze new forms of collaboration and interaction amongst researchers; and build capacity for data- and computational-based projects and training; and be a focal point for coordination of data science activities and partnerships.

Reporting to the Executive Director and working with senior staff in the Division of the Vice-President, Research & Innovation (DVPRI), and the Centre for Research & Innovation Support (CRIS), the Manager will engage in a range of activities and projects at a strategic level to engage and enhance existing and developing supports for data- and computationally-based research at the University of Toronto. CRIS is a joint initiative of the DVPRI, University of Toronto Libraries (UTL), and Information Technology Services (ITS) with a mandate to serve as a researcher-centric resource hub, amplifying access and visibility of all services, training, research tools and support expertise across the University.

The Manager, Data Science Hub provides strategic, tactical and highly professional leadership to advance the University’s academic mission, and in particular its commitment to research and innovation. The Manager serves as a trusted adviser and senior consultant to faculty members, and will advise on optimal supports, solutions, processes, ensuring that projects connect with university-wide and divisional tools and resources (SciNet, the Statistics Toronto Regional Data Centre, SOSCIP and UTL). The Manager collaborates with faculty, academic administrators, and divisional and university-wide research and innovation support units to:

Consult and understand data science research support needs at a strategic, institutional-wide level.
Establish and support new forms of collaboration and interaction amongst data science researchers
Develop and manage strong relationships with CRIS, and university-wide support units and the academic divisions that support data science resources.
Develop and recommend policies and/or guidelines related to research data management that have University-wide impacts.
Develop and maintain approaches to support the efficient and effective connection of researchers to university-wide and divisional research data science resources.
Optimize the use of existing research data and computational supports by providing training and communications, best use cases, and consolidating information, as well as instruction on their use through the Centre for Research & Innovation Support.
Work with the academic divisions, UTL, and ITS to support the direction to existing University data science and computational training, as well as support the creation of innovative training programs for faculty.

The incumbent is a member of the CRIS Advisory Committee, chaired by the Vice-President, Research & Innovation, and Strategic Partnerships, and participates in related working groups as well as strategic-level senior meetings including the DVPRI Research Advisory Board.

Qualifications:
(MINIMUM)

Education:
Post Graduate degree (Master’s or Ph.D.) in a data and/or computational science field or equivalent in education and experience. Ph.D. is strongly preferred.

Experience:
Eight (8) years related administrative experience at a senior level in a university or research focused institution; including experience working in an understanding of the university’s organizational structure. In-depth understanding of the post-secondary environment, the research and innovation landscape across the sciences, social sciences and humanities, and the provision of support for instructional technology. Demonstrated success with the implementation of new initiatives and processes; Demonstrated experience with program development, professional learning, service delivery and evaluation of those activities in a higher education context; proven effective leadership and participation in committee work.

Skills:
Strong leadership and staff management skills; superb research, writing, communication, presentation and interpersonal skills; high degree of political acuity and judgment, consensus building; ability to deal with senior University Officers in a manner which facilitates cooperation and consensus building; ability to work independently with a high degree of initiative, discretion, and tact; ability and willingness to work cooperatively in a challenging and dynamic environment; ability to work under pressure; superior organizational skills in planning, project management flexibility and problem solver orientation; excellent planning and supervisory skills; demonstrated ability to work with a constantly fluctuating workload and to meet deadlines; excellent writing ability and demonstrated ability to work with and gain the support of colleagues.

Other:
Ability to maintain strict confidentiality; high level of professionalism; demonstrated persuasion and negotiation skills. Superior ability to work independently and to be a strategic and creative thinker; Ability to manage a complex set of competing priorities.

Wattpad is a global multiplatform entertainment company whose vision is to entertain and connect the world through stories. Since 2006, we’ve been on a mission to use the power of community and technology to unleash the full potential of stories to the world. Every month 80 million people around the world spend over 23 billion minutes on Wattpad to share and discover stories they can’t find anywhere else. Our brand banner includes: Wattpad, Tap by Wattpad, Wattpad Labs, Wattpad Studios, Wattpad Books and Wattpad Brand Partnerships. We’re proudly based in Toronto, but our reach is global. Come build the future of entertainment and storytelling, and write your next chapter with us!

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our growing Analytics Practice. The Practice’s main focus is to support all of Wattpad's business units and product squads, from building ad-hoc reporting to metrics creation to forecasting and predictive insights projects. The goal is to advocate for and facilitate data-informed decision-making throughout the organization.

In this newly created Senior Data Analyst - Wattpad Studios role, you will need to wear many hats: data miner, analyst, and consultant. Data is critical to how we make content decisions at Wattpad and you will play a key role in helping Wattpad continue to scale!

What you will be doing:
Work cross-functionally across the company, helping make sense of our data and in particular its application to the Wattpad Studios business.
Establish the baselines for many of our metrics, and let us know the costs and benefits of our decision making.
Not just give recommendations from our data, but back them up with statistical tests.
Mine our database on independent research projects you think would be beneficial to Wattpad Studios and the content monetization businesses across Wattpad.
Liaise with business leads across Wattpad Studios and related content monetization teams regarding key learnings and their business applications, taking our technical insights (and problems) and condensing them into an understandable format.
Aid in the development of Wattpad Studios’ analytics offerings and deliverables (i.e. to industry partners).
As a part of the Analytics Practice you will work with other analysts to understand how analytics can best be applied at Wattpad, including best practices, recommendations on tools and technology.

What we’re looking for:
2-5 years working in a data analyst, business analyst, operational analyst, or related analyst role, working in a rigorous data-driven environment, or equivalent experience
Experience with statistical modelling, operational modelling, forecasting, and A/B/N testing
Experience with experimental design, Bayesian inference and ways of refining complex priors is a plus (e.g. Experience with Markov Chain Monte Carlo methods)
Functional, hands-on experience with SQL and Python, in a production environment
Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, as you’ll be working with different teams to help answer questions
University degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field preferred

What we offer:
Competitive salary
Meaningful equity (stock options)
Career development; we believe in mentorship and supporting you to achieve your goals
Hackathons
Health benefits, fully covered on us!
RRSP Contributions
Generous vacation, parental leave top-up
Transit pass, choice of hardware, flexible hours
Corporate discount for gym membership for you and your family
A beautiful office in downtown Toronto, with easy access to transit
And a whole lot more!
Please submit a GitHub repo or Jupyter notebook from a project you’ve completed or worked on. Or, share a link to similar work. This can be from an academic or industry project.

About Wattpad

Who are we? Entrepreneurs and Do-ers. Our vision is to entertain and connect the world through stories, and our mission is to use the power of community and technology to unleash the full potential of stories to the world.
What does that mean? We are visionaries, community builders, passionate problem solvers, storytellers, coffee snobs (tea drinkers, too!), curious by nature, and culturally diverse.
What are we obsessed with? Our users. Solving complex problems and maximizing flow. Learning constantly. Building the next great storytelling product. Finding the greatest stories ever told. Dogs (and cats), coffee, and good snacks.
How do we work? Autonomously, collaboratively, respectfully. Balancing with work, family, and play...and all while having a great time.

Culture and Diversity

Wattpad is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate. Period.

We have taken a leadership position on creating a culture and an organization that truly values diversity. At Wattpad, we believe cultural fit doesn’t mean culturally identical, and diversity of thought helps us to challenge one another to think big and think differently. Our team is as diverse and eclectic as the global Wattpad community. In case it’s not clear: we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Eagle currently has a career opportunity for a Data Engineer and we are looking to speak to qualified candidates with the skills and experience outlined below.

This position is a permanent opportunity located in Toronto, ON to start in March.

Summary:

If working with billions of events, petabytes of data and optimizing for last millisecond is something that excites you then read on! We are looking for Data Engineers who have seen their fair share of messy data sets and have been able to structure them for building useful AI products.

You will be working on writing frameworks building for real-time and batch pipelines to ingest and transform events (108 scales) from 100’s of applications every day. Our ML and Software engineers consume these for building data products like personalization and fraud detection. You will also help optimize the feature pipelines for fast execution and work with software engineers to build event-driven microservices.

You will get to put cutting edge tech in production and freedom to experiment with new frameworks, try new ways to optimize and resources to build the next big thing in fintech using data!

What we’re looking for:
You have previously worked on building serious data pipelines ingesting and transforming > 10 ^6 events per minute and terabytes of data per day.
You are passionate about producing clean, maintainable and testable code part of a real-time data pipeline
You understand how microservices work and are familiar with concepts of data modeling
You can connect different services and processes together even if you have not worked with them before and follow the flow of data through various pipelines to debug data issues
You have worked with Spark and Kafka before and have experimented or heard about Flink/Druid/Ignite/Presto/Athena and understand when to use one over the other
On a bad day maintaining zookeeper and bringing up cluster doesn’t bother you
You may not be a networking expert but you understand issues with ingesting data from applications in multiple data centers across geographies, on-premise and cloud and will find a way to solve them
Proficient in Java/Scala/Python/Spark
What our client offers:
Our client is proud to announce that we have been certified as a Great Place to Work!
A collaborative, open work environment that fosters ownership, creativity, and urgency
Enrolment in the Group Health Benefits plan right from day 1, no waiting period
Fuel for the day: Weekly delivery of groceries and all types of snacks to our office
All types of signature drinks from coffee to lattes to cappuccinos
Catered lunch and desserts on a monthly basis!
Ping Pong and Pool: Become the next Table Tennis/ Pool champ!
And so much more!
COMPENSATION
Flat base salary, unlimited personal and sick days
2 weeks vacation
Excellent medical and dental benefits
Don’t miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!

Job Description

Are you someone who is passionate about data? Group Functions Data Office is seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join the Global Data Enablement and Governance team.

We are seeking a self-motivated individual, who will be responsible for data governance operations and new initiatives for development of data enablement and governance capabilities in the group functions data office. You will design, develop and monitor holistic data governance structures, define and build data management processes and solutions.

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will: -
Perform day to day data governance operational tasks such as access management and develop, maintain and support data management products such as the enterprise data catalogue, data share agreements, critical data elements.
Own accountability, and lead the delivery of data governance projects
Perform requirement gathering, development and roll-out of data quality management, metadata management and access management solutions.
Build data management software products working within the Big Data Space.
Develop data management frameworks, processes and controls, working with information risk management, and compliance to ensure alignment with evolving business, security and regulatory requirements
Research and evaluate new and emerging tools and technology in the data management space, run proof of concepts and provide recommendations
Deliver presentations to various divisional leadership and governance groups
Educate and train teams on data management and governance technology and tools
Requirements for this role include:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, math, or field related to information, data management and analytics with a minimum of 10 years overall relevant experience.
5 - 10 years’ experience in a large technology team with 3+ years in a data mgt. role
Experience with: Informatica Big Data Management, Apache Atlas, Ranger, Big Data/ Hadoop, SQL, Hive, HDFS, Git, Jenkins, Python, Spark, Shell scripting, Java/Scala
Background in: Data Management, Data Analysis/ Stewardship, Data warehouse, relational databases, data ingestion/ ETL.
Experience with Agile, DevOps, continuous integration.
Exceptional oral, written and interpersonal communication skills
Excellent organizational and time management skills, with ability to multi-task.
Ability to work with minimal or no supervision while performing duties.
Strong delivery focus, with the ability to work independently and within teams.
Ability and initiative to organize various functions necessary to accomplish department activities or goals and be a strong teammate.
What about Perks?

Manulife has lots of perks including, but not limited to:
Competitive compensation
Retirement Savings Accounts including a RPP (Pension Plan), RRSP (Retirement Savings Plan), and TFSA (Tax Free Savings account)

Wearing jeans to work every day
An abundance of career paths and opportunities to advance
This is a full-time permanent role located in Toronto, Ontario.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

If you are ready to unleash your potential it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.

About Manulife

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2018, we had more than 34,000 employees, over 82,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving almost 28 million customers. As of September 30, 2019, we had over $1.2 trillion (US$881 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $29.8 billion in payments to our customers.

Our principal operations in Asia, Canada and the United States are where we have served customers for more than 100 years. We trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.

Manulife is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention and advancement and we administer all of our practices and programs based on qualification and performance and without discrimination on any protected ground.

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request any accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

Job Name: Data Analyst - Fixed Income Data Management
descrip:
POSITION:
Data Analyst - Fixed Income Data Management

Why join the CanDeal DataVault team?

CanDeal is a leading provider of electronic marketplaces and data services for Canadian dollar debt securities and derivatives. The Markets Division provides access to a deep pool of liquidity for Canadian government, agency, provincial and corporate bonds, as well as money market instruments and interest rate swaps. CanDeal Solutions delivers data products and other services that support business, trading and technology needs for participants in the Canadian capital markets.

CanDeal’s DataVault Service is a multi-bank initiative to collect and centralize daily and historical Canadian bank-generated fixed income over-the-counter (OTC) quotes and trades, which are enriched with security master reference data and derived issue-level FRTB (Fundamental Review of the Trading Book) modellability based on pooled transaction data. Security master reference data is sourced from banks and data vendors, including S&P CUSIP and DBRS for Ratings and Sectors.

DataVault's Data-as-a-Service (DaaS) Portal stores the data in a secure shared service owned and governed by the banks and operated by CanDeal DataVault. The Portal supports web-based query, reporting and downloading of FRTB real price observation modellability reports, trade reports, and indicative quotes. Data can also be downloaded and accessed via API.

In addition to the Portal, DataVault will be introducing file-based data products in 2020 addressing requirements for composite, evaluated and Independent Price verification (IPV).

CanDeal is a growing and entrepreneurial organization with an extremely solid foundation and an ownership group which includes: BMO Nesbitt Burns Inc., CIBC World Markets, National Bank Financial Inc., RBC Capital Markets, Scotia Capital, TD Securities and TMX Group.

This is an exciting time to join a growing organization led by visionary leaders who are helping to shape their industry’s future.

About the opportunity

CanDeal is looking for a highly motivated, self-driven individual with experience in Data Management, Analytics and Governance functions within Financial Services and Capital Markets to join the DataVault Data Operations team. The DataVault Data Operations team is focused on the governance, management and quality of data assets to ensure timely, accurate and usable data. The team provides subject matter expertise across numerous data domains including Fixed Income and Derivatives, security master,enterprise reference, pricing, and trade data that is vital to DataVaultproducts and customers. This is an exciting opportunity to get involved in the implementation and maintenance of CanDeal’s DataVault Service. If you enjoy working in an entrepreneurial environment, in a role that will expand over time, then we would like to hear from you!

What you will be doing?

Data Governance, including but not limited to:
Monitor data related standards, policies, and procedures to minimize risk and deliver business value .

Define, implement, monitor and maintain data governance and data stewardship KPIs (performance measurements) and facilitate methods to address exceptions to predetermined thresholds, monitoring through completion.

Development of standards, tools, and governance for capturing, modeling, storing, and delivering the highest quality data.

Prepare and publish data governance and compliance reports for internal management.

Business Metadata Management, including but not limited to:
Develop and maintain OTC Fixed Income, Security Master, and Reference Data taxonomies, metadata models, and classification schemes.

Collect and maintainthe the DataVault Data Catalogue and Data Glossary (key business metadata including data definitions; rules; lineage; data lifecycle; security; privacy; tiering; SLAs; common metric definitions; and process, organization, location and application models).

Drive the capture of business definitions, taxonomies and linkage to technical lineage.

Resolve metadata issues and communicating resolutions.

Prepare and publish metadata quality reports for internal management.

Master and Reference Management, including but not limited to:

Define and maintain data management processes ensuring data is of the highest quality and meets product, customer and regulatory requirements and standards (e.g., data matching, cleansing and control processes).

Monitor master and reference data quality.

Define and maintain master and reference data (security master, issuer master, reference code sets, matching and survivorship rules, reference data mapping rules) and workflow processes.

Perform data quality management processes ensuring data is of the highest quality and meets product, customer and regulatory requirements and standards. Including but not limited to:

Monitoring as it relates to the assessment, improvement and governance of data quality and ongoing fitness-for-purpose of critical data assets.

Define, develop and implement data quality measurements that support product, client and regulatory defined goals and requirements.

Maintain thresholds and publishdata quality metrics (data quality dashboard and internal data quality management reporting).

Data Quality Issue Management, including but not limited to:
Identify, define, quantify, prioritize and track data quality issues.

Act as the escalation point of contact for resolution and management of Data Quality Issues, coordinating resolutions between internal and external customers and vendors.

Business Analysis:
Develop subject matter expertise across different asset classes and understand the data used by products and customers.

Work closely with stakeholders to define and manage data requirements and recommend solutions.

Recommend business solutions that satisfy sponsor/stakeholder needs and continually explore and assess options for value-add to clients.

Review detailed design specifications, test plans and user documentation for functional and technical completeness and accuracy.

Contribute to the development of test cases for data quality issues.

Contribute to the development and execution of testing including defect/bug review and resolution.

Contribute content for end user documentation and training.

Relationships & Communication:
Create a superior client experience and strengthen relationships with internal and external clients and vendors.

Participate and collaborate actively in business, product and regulatory initiatives that have a significant data impact.

Resolve conflicts/issues and escalate to others as appropriate.

What we are looking for:
Minimum of 5 years working experience in the financial services industry

Good knowledge of Fixed Income, OTC markets structure and operations is desired.

Good understanding of data management and governance principles and best practices (data governance, data modeling, data quality, data lineage, master data management, metadata management, data analytics, etc.).

Strong business and technical background in the area of Master & Reference Data Management.

Proficiency in creating source-to-target mapping, including handling complex taxonomies.

Solid experience with SQL and Excel; knowledge of Python is nice to have.

Quantitative analytic skills, including data presentation.

Strong service orientation; a track record of responsiveness to partner needs

Excellent communication skills, both written and oral.

Ability to thrive in a high performing culture and work effectively under pressure.

Self-motivated, confident and capable of working both independently and in a team environment.

Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects, many with tight deadlines.

Ability to think critically and make decisions.

University degree

Like what you’re hearing so far, but still wondering if CanDeal is right for you? We offer:

Working in an entrepreneurial and growing organization.

Ongoing on-the-job learning and development; learning from a leader with a wealth of knowledge.

Working with innovative technology and with an industry pioneer.

Opportunity to evolve with a growing organization

Interested in being a part of CanDeal? We look forward to your application!

Please inform us if you require any accommodations during the hiring process. Please note that only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

What You'll Do:

What You Can Expect:
We are a team of diverse and ambitious analysts, who cultivate a friendly and inclusive work environment where you can be yourself. Our employees’ development is at the core of our business, offering endless possibilities for growth, learning and mobility. Let us help grow your skills through one of our many resources including the Loblaw Virtual Learning Centre, where you have access to hundreds of learning tools, or through casual coffee chats with our leaders who were once in your shoes.

Other perks of joining Loblaw:
Competitive compensation and benefits package
Office with incredible amenities including an on-site gym, volleyball court and basketball court (turned ice rink in the winter!) with flexibility to work elsewhere

How You’ll Succeed:
At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.

If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.

In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

Teranet is the exclusive provider of Ontario’s online property search and registration. We developed, own and operate the Ontario Electronic Land Registration System - one of the most advanced, secure and sophisticated land registration systems in the world. Teranet is owned by OMERS Infrastructure, a leading global infrastructure investment manager and the infrastructure arm of the Ontario Municipal Employee Retirement System.

Job Description

The Data Science Specialist is responsible for the execution of our Commercials Solutions data strategy governing a broad portfolio of products within the Value Added Solutions business.

The incumbent will be primarily responsible for developing new data solutions and enhancing existing data solutions to key customers and partners; delivering exists data solutions per customer contracts; supporting sales team for customer inquiries; supporting marketing team with data analytics content and samples. In addition, the Data Science Specialist plays a key role in acquiring more and better data, enhancing data quality, and enhancing the accuracy of the products supported (such as valuation algorithm accuracy). This individual will support the development of productive long-term relationships with a variety of external parties including municipal and provincial governments as well as corporate data partners.

Specific Responsibilities

Innovation

Identify customer needs and define customer requirements

Data Operations

Define data quality operational standards to improve operational efficiencies with multiple 3rd party sources
Recommend data normalization and standardization best practices to improve customer experience.
Implement data quality metrics with appropriate internal / external reporting
Preparation and maintenance of data-related processes and procedures

Sales/Partner Support

Support inquiries from sales team and other internal partners (e.g. marketing & finance) to drive revenue growth

Examples include:
Provide domain expertise in data and data products to support sales team
Support the preparation of RFI/RFP proposals
Provide AVM (Automated Valuation Model) update requests
Generate necessary data reports and activity reports for clients
Provide content and data samples to marketing team

Qualifications :

Experience with various data analytic tools such as R, SAS, VBA and Python

Element AI is one of the world's largest artificial intelligence companies, with a shared goal of using our extensive research to develop AI products and software that will solve some of the most challenging issues facing businesses and society as a whole.

We are founded on the belief that humans should be at the heart of everything we do, and have adopted a people-first and collaborative mindset to ensure we collectively drive real and ethically-sound results.

As an applied research scientist in the Financial Products group at Element AI, you will sit in a cross-functional team with several other people with a diversity of skill sets and you will enjoy a unique opportunity to use your creativity towards applying cutting edge machine learning and operations research methods to problems with significant impact in the financial industry. While doing so you will have access to the best hardware and you will be assisted by a team of IT experts and software developers, to ensure most of your time is spent on core R&D challenges.

What you'll do

You will be confronted with real-world challenges and datasets, and you will need to use your AI/ML expertise and creativity to apply existing methods and develop new ones to solve these problems in a practical and scalable way. You will be called upon to assess possibilities and provide ideas and input into product design choices. This will involve understanding your customer (internal or external) needs and and translating them into solutions that address those needs.

You will be expected to both do the necessary research to propose appropriate models/techniques and to have the necessary expertise to implement and train the models yourself. Where useful, you will not hesitate to employ classical machine learning methods, but you are enthusiastic at the idea of pushing the boundaries of deep learning and AI.

Finally, you will be expected to embrace the fact that the value of your work is ultimately reflected in the impact it has on the end-customers using our products and to find ways of measuring that impact as an integral part of your mission.

What we're looking for

You have significant understanding of the underlying theory of machine learning, operations research or related AI field. In the Financial Products group, we are specifically interested in skill sets related to reinforcement learning, dynamic programming, deep learning, time series analysis & forecasting and backtesting, optimization, simulation, generative models, and similar. This expertise can come from extensive studies, previous industrial experience or awesome self-taught projects you have done on a personal basis. You're also a solid programmer and you're comfortable doing scientific programming as well as solution development and do not mind getting your hands dirty in various coding and engineering tasks. This includes embracing modern devops principles to development and working in a setting where code is expected to be shared and peer-reviewed.

You understand that running a model on the varied and often noisy data that arises in a commercial context differs significantly from running it on a clean academic dataset, and that modifying a model or technique to work in that setting can be a significant and sometimes frustrating challenge. You embrace this challenge and may even have previous experience tackling it.

You learn autonomously and will enthusiastically stay up to date in the literature and techniques of your field while participating in the various learning opportunities we offer.

What we offer for your valuable work:
Work closely with other AI enthusiasts;
Enjoy your work and life harmony;
Leave your mark in a thriving industry;
Apply your talent to tackling new challenges everyday;
Be surprised at how much you will learn;
Open and inclusive company culture.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Employer: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health
descrip:
Job Number: 855948

Category: Research

Positions Available: 1

Years Experience Required: 1-3

Location: Toronto, Ontario

Posted Date: Mar 2, 2020

EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY
Independent Scientist (Biostatistician)
Clinical Research
Physician-in-Chief Office

Position Description
The Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH) is seeking a full-time, permanent Independent Scientist (biostatistician) to provide statistical expertise and consulting for clinical research studies and development of clinical programs. Reporting to the Physician-in-Chief and working closely with the lead of the biostatistical support core for Clinical Research at CAMH, the successful candidate will assist in knowledge synthesis, protocol development, study design, development of statistical methodology and determining and executing data analysis approaches. The position will require interprofessional collaboration and working on a variety of clinical research studies to support study protocol development and review and may include authorship of statistical sections of protocols and clinical study reports across the divisions of CAMH clinical research. In addition to these responsibilities, the position will incorporate the development of innovative statistical methodology for solutions to complex research questions from a variety of disciplines. This position will be located at 1001 Queen Street West.

Qualifications
The successful applicant will have a Ph.D. in Statistics, Biostatistics or related field to include three (3) years of relevant experience and will be eligible for academic appointment at the University of Toronto. The successful applicant will obtain a scientific appointment as an Independent Scientist at CAMH and comply with all associated responsibilities as set out in the CAMH Scientific Appointment Policy (i.e. complete research training, obtain a portfolio of external funding, publish in high impact peer-reviewed journals and supervise CAMH staff and/or students). The Independent Scientist will also be self-directed and conduct research activities autonomously under the direction of the lead biostatistician and Physician-in-Chief.

Candidates must also demonstrate excellence or potential for excellence in collaborative research, preferably in mental health and/or addictions; as well as experience in the design, analysis and reporting of clinical research across a wide range of disciplines. In-depth knowledge of general statistical methodology, programming and database management using a variety of programs, including but not limited to SAS, SPSS, R, Mplus and REDCap is required. Previous experience in quantitative knowledge synthesis methods (e.g., meta-analysis, integrative data analysis) is preferred. The successful candidate will be able to work independently and possess the capacity for self-directed work and supervision and mentoring of students, as well as excel working as part of an interdisciplinary team, with strong interpersonal, communication and writing skills. The successful candidate will be comfortable working in a dynamic fast paced health care environment committed to patient centered care, accountability, collaboration, teamwork and measurement of clinical outcomes. The ability to work with individuals of diverse ethnoracial and cultural backgrounds is required. Bilingualism (French/English) and/or proficiency in a second language would be an asset.

Please note: This full-time, permanent position is NOT part of any bargaining unit.
Salary Range: Competitive salary and benefits package.

CAMH is a Tobacco-Free Organization.

CAMH is fully affiliated with the University of Toronto and is a teaching hospital and research institute. As a CAMH employee you will be expected to actively support CAMH’s teaching and research activities, in addition to supporting the clinical work of the hospital.

As an employment equity employer CAMH actively seeks Aboriginal peoples, visible minorities, women, people with disabilities, (including people with who have experienced mental health and substance use challenges), and additional diverse identities for our workforce.

The role will be responsible for the development of purification processes for the generation of clinical trials material (proteins and viruses) from microbial and animal cell culture.

Plan and supervise execution of product development activities (develop, improve, scale-up processes, and provide material and documentation for purified proteins or viruses) within platform for the project to ensure scientific and technical excellence. Here at Rakuten Kobo Inc. we offer a casual working start-up environment and a group of friendly and talented individuals. Our employees rank us highly in terms of commitment to work / life balance. We realize that for our people to be innovative, creative and passionate they need to have healthy minds and bodies. We believe in rewarding all our employees with competitive salaries, performance based annual bonuses, stock options and training opportunities.

If you’re looking for a company that inspires passion, personal, and professional growth – join Kobo and come help us make reading lives better.

The Role:

Rakuten Kobo Inc. is seeking an Analytics Manager to join our Big Data and Analytics team. The analytics team plays a critical role: the team is responsible for ensuring decision makers in the company have best-in-class past, present, and future visibility into our customer behaviours and business performance. We have access to rich data from our millions of readers across the globe that interact with our website, our e-reading devices, and our iOS and Android apps, and you’ll be supported by Data Engineering and Data Architect roles. Reporting to the Director of Big Data and Analytics, you will be responsible for leading and empowering a team of data analysts and scientists to help shape the future of our products & services.

The Responsibilities:
Provide mentorship and oversight for analytics projects and deliverables.
Develop and evolve frameworks to measure and predict product usage, customer value, and attrition.
Foster and facilitate a company-wide focus on data-driven decisions and data democratization.
Participate in defining analytic requirements for new projects and manage the delivery of new dashboards and reports.
Document, publish, and present the processes, science, and findings of the team.
Further the team’s depth of knowledge by following and implementing industry best practices.


Qualifications
B.Sc. or greater in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or a related quantitative field.
5+ years experience developing and communicating advanced analytics.
3+ years experience developing statistical models (e.g. acquisition, predictive value, time series analysis.)
1+ year experience using Big Data or ML technology (e.g. Spark,MapReduce,TensorFlow.)
5+ years SQL experience.
5+ years data visualization experience.
Experience with Python & R.
Proven analytical and critical thinking skills, able to synthesize information from many sources to draw conclusions and learnings.



The Perks:

Flexible hours and no office dress code
Pooch Program that allows you to bring your furry friends to the office
Full benefits starting from your first day
Paid Volunteer days, unlimited sick days, and 3% RRSP matching
Monthly commuting allowance
Flexible health spending account
Talent and development training budget
Free Kobo device + free weekly e-book or audiobook
Frequent Lunch and Learns Author series
Weekly Kobo Tech University sessions
Onsite gym
Weekly happy hours (Thirsty Thursdays, as we like to call it)
Maternity/paternity leave top up
About Rakuten Kobo Inc.

Owned by Tokyo-based Rakuten and headquartered in Toronto, Rakuten Kobo Inc. is one of the world’s most innovative eReading services offering more than 6 million eBooks and audiobooks to millions of customers in 190 countries. Believing that consumers should have the freedom to read any book on any device, Kobo provides people with a choice when reading. Kobo offers an eReader for everyone with a wide variety of E Ink eReaders to suit any Reader’s style including the Kobo Clara HD, Kobo Aura, Kobo Aura H2O, Kobo Aura ONE and Kobo Forma; along with the company’s free top-ranking eReading and audiobook listening app for iOS® and Android®. Kobo’s award-winning eReaders can be found in major retail chains around the world. For more information, visit www.kobo.com.
