Job Name: Backend Data Engineer, Machine Intelligence Retention
descrip:
Backend Data Engineer, Machine Intelligence Retention

CBC Digital Products is the country's biggest digital innovator, taking on the challenges of defining how media is made, sent and received. We are also part of Canada's oldest and truest broadcasting company. We are trying new things. We are growing. As an entity of our own. As a voice for our country. As a team.

Digital is a part of our present and all of our future. CBC's strategy is focused on becoming a digital-first organization that provides a digital platform for storytellers. Our mission is to engage our audience with stories they care about.

The opportunity

The Machine Intelligence Retention team has a vision to enable better decisions through big data. As part of CBC's initiative to reach all Canadians, our data platform is becoming the central hub for data insights and analysis that other teams can rely on as we continue to join disparate pieces of data together. Our goal is to build a product that identifies the drivers behind loyalty and retention for audiences and provides information to CBC content producers about their audiences.

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Data Science, and Machine Intelligence, we are adding a Backend Data Engineer to play a critical role in the design and implementation of a middle tier for our powerful data management platform. As we move towards developing insights and recommendations in real-time, our team is looking for someone who is passionate about Machine Intelligence, confident in their capabilities, and eager to innovate. New project work that you may be involved with includes:
Building out a content analytics platform. You will be creating a connection between the back-end data platform with the audience facing components of our product in a scalable way. In addition you will be creating API endpoints that enable other teams to connect to our back end.
If you're passionate about Canada and you love technology, learning, and bringing out the best in others, you'll love working at CBC.

Who you are

You are a developer with software and data engineering skills along with strong middle layer implementation skills and a deep understanding of front end and backend components. You have hands-on experience designing and building scalable infrastructure to support robust data platforms. You are passionate about data distribution. You may be at a startup or a corporate innovation lab. Either way, you are seeking an opportunity to make a measurable impact. You want to apply your expertise scaling solutions that enable the application of real-time insights to improve and enhance increased engaging experiences for the 18M Canadians who visit the CBC's digital offerings every month.

What's in it for you

Cutting edge tech: CBC has more than 25 digital sites, all of which are mandated to reach Canadians online everywhere and every way, with equal importance on their preferences and choices regardless of location. To achieve that goal, we have built a data management platform and are now focused on enhancing the machine intelligence capabilities for more in-depth analysis and actionable insights.

Belonging. CBC/Radio-Canada is a Canadian institution. By joining and helping to build our dynamic Digital team, you will be exposed to the best of all worlds. Corporate. Public. Startup. You will be part of a team that embraces diversity and, at its core, truly cares about the country and the world, a genuinely close-knit, fun, and collaborative team that believes in supporting the work of its members.

Career growth. The CBC is fully invested in our people. Whatever it is you want to pursue whether it's a new programming language, a technical solution, expanding your Agile knowledge, or building your leadership skills we will provide you with the time, resources, and guidance that you need to keep your career here rewarding.

How you will make a difference, you will:
Build and deploy scalable and robust infrastructure for backend services and good APIs.
Define an integrated, RESTful/SOAP API or ETL solution design with support from front-end and back-end system teams.
Rapidly deliver and maintain high-performance, scalable systems, tools and processes to meet the needs of our rapidly growing engineering teams.
Create design artifacts using RAML and JSON Schema standards.
Why join us?

CBC/Radio-Canada reflects Canadian identity and promotes democracy. Our digital team's values - collaboration, learning and continuous improvement - embody who we are as a people-focused, digital-forward employer. We offer a rare-in-tech work-life balance with flexible schedules, and excellent benefits package; we want you to be happy in and out of the office.

Collaboration. We follow lean startup principles and use an Agile approach. Our dedicated people managers work closely with every individual to ensure we are leveraging their strengths, championing their ideas and supporting their pursuit of new skills and career progression.

Learning. From simply buying a book or recommending a course to one-on-ones, our leadership team is focused on creating an atmosphere where people feel fulfilled. Our team members are given opportunities to learn and work cross-functionally across multiple projects.

Continuous improvement. What can you innovate in 8 hours a week? Our Digital department at CBC recognizes just how smart, creative and inventive our team members are. From prototyping new UI/UX to setting up dev environments to experiment on and learning new programming languages to creating improved search functions for our media. Wherever your interests lie, your 20% time is yours to allocate in a productive and professionally gratifying way.

What you bring:
The education. You have a Master's degree in Computer Science or Science. A Bachelor's degree will be considered in combination with your other qualifications.
The hands-on experience. You have 2+ years developing APIs and 1+ year on the Data Engineering side of a machine learning platform development. You have exposure to machine learning-as-a-service architecture for data preparation. You are familiar with:
The components and infrastructure needed for machine learning.
Developing APIs, including the integration of endpoints.
Python, SQL, GCP, ETLs.
Big data/ Real-time data.
Cloud deployment, ideal but not mandatory.
The knowledge. You have direct experience tackling ambiguous technical challenges and designing solutions from scratch. You can explain why different technologies and processes are needed, not just how they work. You have insights gained from lessons learned and the knowledge to support your recommendations.
The passion and innovation. You are passionate about big data and the impact real-time data-driven insights can have. You love the challenge of researching, trialling, and implementing cutting-edge solutions to complex problems. You believe in the Agile methodology deeply, but you are flexible and open to the real-world twists and turns.
The communication and collaboration skills. You know how to listen and understand diverse perspectives, fostering positive relationships across teams. You thrive in a team-focused environment.
To apply

Think this job is meant for you but worried you don't have it all? At CBC we know that not everyone takes the same path when it comes to building their skills. You can read about the various backgrounds the talented people that make up our team bring to us here.

Hands-on experience, intelligence, innovation, a passion for learning and a team-focused approach can combine to form the best set of qualifications. If you feel you meet all or most of the qualifications we are seeking; and you are excited by the possibility of growing our company, take a chance and express your interest here.

What you can expect from our interview process:
A phone interview discussing your interest in the role, the team's culture and how you can grow as an engineer and beyond within Digital Products.
A short technical assessment.
An in-person interview with a panel of team members and your future Senior Manager during which you can ask questions, learn about our culture and growth opportunities and dive deeper into your process and how you will work with us.
In becoming the leader in expressing Canadian culture and enriching democratic life, we need to be as diverse in every way as the country we serve, both within our workforce and on air. As an employer, we value equal opportunity and nurture an inclusive workplace where our individual differences are not only recognized and valued, but also extend to and pervade all the services we provide as Canada's public broadcaster.

CBC/Radio-Canada is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required, and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please contact us.

Help us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

In addition to submitting your application for this role, please visit this link to complete an initial screening questionnaire.
What you’ll do
Participate in and champion the design, development and implementation of an enterprise data governance framework and supporting programs.
Gather business requirements and design solutions for Metadata and Reference Data Management, Data Quality and Customer MDM building enterprise level capabilities.
Perform data profiling and data mining to define data patterns within Metadata and Reference Data Management, Data Quality and Customer MDM solutions.
Using programming languages, develop, implement and support enterprise business solutions for Metadata and Reference Data Management, Data Quality and Customer MDM solutions.
Provide operational support for solutions developed as well as for technology platform for Metadata and Reference Data Management, Data Quality and Customer MDM within defined SLAs.
Identify, design and implement internal processes improvements, automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery.
Perform root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment
Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business
Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business
Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward
If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.
What you bring
Post secondary education in Information Management, Data Management, Computer Science or relevant discipline.
5 years of Data Analysis and Software Development experience in a corporate environment.
Strong knowledge of data management concepts and experience in data warehousing, modelling, standards and policies.
Experience with data curation: profiling and classification, data lineage, encryption and auditing/monitoring.
Knowledge of metadata management tools, data quality and business intelligence tools.
Experience with software and data development environments; DevOps, Agile and CICD processes.
Strong understanding of cloud data storage and management solutions, preferable Azure and GCP.
Advanced experience with programming languages (Java, JavaScript, SQL, Python, Shell Scripts, Spark, Hive, and MapReduce) and databases (Hadoop ecosystem, Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server, SQLite, PostgreSQL)
Demonstrated excellent interpersonal and communication skills, able to influence at different levels of the organization and promote cross functional collaboration.
Demonstrated knowledge and experience in implementing and managing projects.
About Canadian Tire Corporation

Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies.

To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on LinkedIn.

#LI-SS1

Data is a big deal at Index Exchange (IX). IX's advertising exchange handles billions of auctions and generates terabytes of auction-related information every day. Our team builds tools and infrastructure to manage this vast amount of data and make it accessible for our customers. We're looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join our team, and help build the next generation of big data solutions at Index Exchange with real-time streaming and batch analytical capabilities.

Working with exciting technologies, your team will experiment with new tools and engineer innovative approaches to solve interesting challenges. Things shift very quickly in our industry, and we rely on our Engineering teams to keep IX and our clients ahead of the curve and moving in the right direction. We're looking for Engineers who have experience in an Agile environment, who can drive innovation, and be a technical leader on our team.

Here's what we want:
Problem Solver: You are curious and love exploring multiple approaches to find the most efficient, scalable solution and solve a problem
Collaborative: You work well with other people
Passionate: You have a passion for Big Data and an interest in the latest trends and developments constantly researching new tools and data technologies
Self-starter: You are comfortable helping your team get things done
Leadership: You can mentor the team on the design, and implementation of our solutions
Here's what you'll be doing:
Design, implement, and maintain data pipelines for extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources to various data services
Identify, design, and implement system performance improvements
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements
Automate manual processes and optimize data delivery
Guide and mentor team members
Identify and assess potential solutions for technical and business suitability
Useful skills/background:

You may or may not tick off every box, and that's ok. Each person brings a different background and different skills. If you think you are a good match for what we are looking for tell us why, and tell us what you are doing to improve yourself and we'll see what we can do to help!
Bachelor/Master degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Computer/Electrical Engineering or related field
7+ years of work experience in a software engineering environment
Experience working in Agile methodologies
3+ years of work experience designing and building high performance data applications with Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Hive or other equivalent technologies
Proficiency in some of the following languages: Scala, Java, Python, Bash
Deep understanding of design principles of distributed systems and familiar with mainstream big data related technologies and distributed frameworks
Experience with SQL and NoSQL systems
Experience with automated testing systems
Mentorship, collaboration, and communication skills
Knowledge of data modelling, data warehousing, ETL processes, and business intelligence reporting tools
Experience optimizing performance with large data sets
Experience working with CI/CD, containerization, and virtualization tools such as Gitlab, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Docker
Why you'll love working here:
Work out of our downtown Toronto office with easy transit access
Flexible hours and relaxed dress code
Excellent family benefits at a family focused company
Open concept office designed to facilitate communication and collaboration
Free snacks, drinks, and lunch catered on Fridays
Annual celebrations (Summer BBQ, Holiday Party, All Hands, Hack Days) and milestone outings
Full family healthcare benefits, paid vacation, unlimited sick days, 5% RRSP matching, discounted gym memberships and more

Job Name: Research Scientist, Augmented and Virtual Reality
descrip:
Location: Toronto- Canada
Job ID: 19WD36085

Research Team @ Autodesk
Autodesk Research is a team of expert scientists exploring and creating technologies to help improve design and its role in society through high-level customer projects, collaboration with leading research universities worldwide, and publications at world-renowned scientific venues.

Position Overview
The User Interface Research Groupat Autodesk Research is seeking exceptionally talented research scientists to work on cutting-edge Human-Computer Interaction research on the topic of Augmented and Virtual Reality. This topic area could encompass research in many areas including: developing and understanding novel interfaces and interaction techniques; studying and leveraging perceptual and cognitive factors with virtual and augmented reality; investigating collaborative virtual environments and unique opportunities within multi-user VR and AR; understanding and developing novel applications of VR. Successful candidates will have a demonstrated track record of broadly recognized research results in leading conferences and publication venues (e.g., ACM CHI, UIST, IUI, IEEE VR, ISMAR, VIS or similar).

The overall mission of the User Interface Research Group is to: Apply Human-Computer Interaction expertise to develop fundamental understandings of how humans perceive. Learn, and interact with technology, and based on these understandings, to develop novel interfaces and visualizationsto solve current problems, explore future opportunities, and influence Autodesk’s corporate strategy. A particular area of interest for our group is how the digital trails that humans leave as they interact with technology and the environment can be used to improve their future experiences.

Responsibilities
Conceive, plan, develop, and implement scientific research projects to advance scientific knowledge in business-relevant areas
Publish papers in peer-reviewed scientific journals/conferences
Supervise research interns (typically PhD students from top research universities)
Present research findings at conferences and participate in research collaborations with external research institutes and universities
Communicate and promote the use of research findings throughout Autodesk
Consult with product teams on the implementation of research findings into products
Generate intellectual property such as patents and trade-secrets from research findings
Manage and coordinate projects as they move from research prototype to shipping products or services
Minimum Qualifications
Ph.D. in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or other relevant disciplines, ideally on the topic of Human-Computer Interaction or a closely-related area
Demonstrated experience of HCI research fundamentals, including experience designing and evaluating novel interfaces and technologies
Strong history of publications in HCI or related fields
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to quickly learn new technologies and adapt to new situations
Ability to conduct quantitative and qualitative studies to evaluate concepts, designs, and systems
Ability to work collaboratively with people from many different disciplines (design, development, etc.)

There is more to it than meets the eye…

Join our team

Today, TELUS customers enjoy a clear and simple bill. Behind the scenes, however, hundreds of different systems are at play determining how much each customer pays for their TELUS service. The Wireless Service Analytics & Transformation (Wireless SAT) team builds solutions for our stakeholders which pull data from the hundreds of systems to detect operational issues, revenue leakage, and produce dashboards for business, strategic and executive consumption. We love to turn data into stories-stories about money falling through the cracks, success stories about our products and services, but most importantly stories about our customers and how we can enhance their experience. We run like a start-up and we have embraced lean and agile methodologies. We celebrate our failures and see them as opportunities to learn. Our culture fosters collaborative learning and out-of-the-box thinking in a relaxed environment. Come help us to make something awesome!

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

You are a skilled technical lead with a passion for discovering and automating data analysis and insights. You know how to leverage your eye for strategy and exceptional judgement to communicate these insights to our team and our stakeholders.

Together, with this team of analytics consultants and data scientists, you will help discover how the key performance indicators (KPIs) we track ladder up to the customer and business outcomes we are driving for TELUS. We are part of a larger team focusing on how we can leverage our data expertise and our network data in order to improve our products and services for our customers. As a result, we will work with stakeholders across the company from product and services, marketing, service assurance to network DevOps teams.

You will be creating scripts and tools to enhance and maintain critical insights from raw data. You will be developing dashboard reporting using advanced analytics tools and collaborating with internal business partners to continuously deliver value by adding alerting, proactive or predictive capabilities. You will drive process improvement through automation and learn to apply AI, and Machine Learning to help our stakeholders unlock the potential from their data.

Here’s how

Our work is a combination of Regular, Exciting and Weird:
Regular: Creating automated data loading flows to pull in data from many different sources, then using that data to build a visually compelling presentation layer
Exciting: Finding millions of dollars of missing money or hacking together a sentiment analysis of customers responses to our usage notifications
Weird: Spend a week doing nothing but eating Cheetos
Qualifications

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle
Recognized as a technical leader with an innate ability to develop and motivate team members, as well as positively influence change
Passion for data and new technologies
Acknowledged for your strong general knowledge of the overall data analysis technology ecosystem
Known for your deep specific knowledge in one or two specific data analysis technology stacks
Confident in the use of Agile, iterative, Lean product lifecycles
Commended for your ability to communicate clearly and collaborate with a broad array of stakeholders at all levels
Knack for collaboration, openly contributing ideas within a highly cross-functional team
Willingness to do both Development and Operations
Confident with your ability to articulate an end-to-end customer experience
Skilled in assessing and articulating the financial impact of a customer experience
Senior level experience of 5+ years’ within the industry
Have a Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Computer Science
Great-to-haves
Database bingo: SQL; noSQL; Hadoop; Oracle; MongoDB;
ETL bingo: ELK; DOMO; Tableau; Splunk;
Programming bingo: JAVA; Python; UNIX; Selenium; Cucumber;
Process bingo: Agile; Scrum; Kanban
Other tools: Slack; Assembla; Google Suite;
Telecom knowledge

Responsibilities
Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture.
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS ‘big data’ technologies.
Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centers and AWS regions.
Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
Qualifications
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
Strong Java/Scala with spark developer experience in developing batch and real-time streaming applications.
We are looking for a candidate with 5+ years of experience in a Data Engineer role, who has attained a Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field. They should also have experience using the following software/tools:
Experience with big data tools: Hive, Spark, Kafka, Jenkins, Java 8, Scala
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra.
Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc.

Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
Experience with Jenkins and ansible, understand CI and CD principles.

Environmental Lead Scientist

Fort St. John, BC

We are currently recruiting for an Environmental Lead Scientist to join our team in Fort St. John. Candidates must be willing to move to Fort St. John. More information will be provided in the interview.

We are a leading firm in the fields of environmental remediation, reclamation, and natural sciences throughout British Columbia. Our specialty is upstream oil and gas; however, we provide a broad array of environmental services with offices in Fort St John and Port Moody, BC.

POSITION OVERVIEW

The primary function of the Environmental Lead Scientist is to assist the Environmental Project Manager to plan and complete a project. The Environmental Lead Scientist may be responsible for project budgets, timelines, deliverables, completion of advanced field programs and preparation of technical reports. To maintain a direct connection to the field staff, work in the field will be required as determined by each project. This position provides direction to the Environmental Scientist and reports to the Environmental Project Manager or Environmental Client Manager.

Specifically, you will
Become thoroughly knowledgeable with the project's contract documents, drawings, specifications and scope of work
Support field operations in aspects which may include cost controls, planning, scheduling and estimating
Complete technical report writing and signature on factual technical reports
Maintain current knowledge with governing regulatory bodies as it applies to the OGC, MOE
Manage data and file compilation for internal and client databases
Review and resolve concerns regarding issues and performance of the project, to Project Managers
Maintain billable targets as set by Supervisor
Coordinate with and manage Contractors
Coordinate and facilitate successful project deliverables
Provide excellent levels of service to our internal and external clients and represent SynergyAspen Environmental and our clients in a professional manner consistent with corporate values and behaviours
Qualifications Requirements
B.Sc. in Engineering (environmental, chemical, civil, mechanical, geotechnical), Geology or Environmental Science, Biology or equivalent
Ability to be registered as a Professional (EIT, GIT, AIT, BIT, CET)
4-10 years’ industry experience, preferably within environmental consulting and/or upstream oil and gas
Considerable knowledge of industry regulatory-accepted standards, guidelines, procedures, and practices
Experience working in reclamation and/or remediation and/or natural sciences
Knowledge of project execution activities such as planning, project controls, scheduling and costing
Fly in/out camp schedule
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint
Excellent verbal, written, interpersonal communication and organisational skills
Ability to work collaboratively with junior and senior staff of multiple disciplines, within teams on various projects of differing complexity and work effectively with environmental subcontractors
Work outside in adverse weather conditions, when required; travel for work in potentially remote locations, as needed per project demands
Exceptional accuracy and attention to detail; Excellent communication and technical writing skills, and
A strong work ethic, positive attitude, and willingness to learn
Available to work in the Fort St.John and Port Moody area and possibly alternate locations, as needed;

Toronto, CANADA - MULTIPLE ROLES

Do you want to help change the way people understand, design for and solve the most challenging real-world design problems in their fields using a combination of Computational Science and Artificial Intelligence? Augmenta is seeking exceptional talent to help us perform research and development on complex multi-industry workflow and design automation challenges.

What you get

You will get in at the earliest stage, to help design and develop the fundamental architecture for the world’s first creative/generative AI platform. Your work will have a profound impact on complex industry challenges, and the software you write will result in new designs you will see applied in the real world.

You will be a part of an exceptional, cross-disciplinary founding team who spearheaded development and adoption of Generative Design technologies, and have delivered cutting-edge work for organizations like NASA, General Motors, Autodesk, Facebook, Royal Bank of Canada and ALDO. You will continually be in contact with and learning from cutting edge researchers and domain experts across industries.

What you will do

Research, design and implement robust, scalable mathematical models for behavioral modeling, simulation and calibration of industry workflows and processes

Investigate state-of-the-art machine learning methods by keeping abreast of bleeding-edge literature, interfacing with academic partners and attending appropriate scientific workshops/conferences

Collaborate with multidisciplinary team in multiple locations

Mentor junior staff and interns to reach their best potential

Required Qualifications

M.Sc./Ph.D. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or related disciplines

Fluent in C++ and Python

Exceptional knowledge of linear algebra and calculus

Research, design and performance optimization of complex mathematical models

Ability to abstract complex parametric and non-parametric systems into representations amenable to supervised and unsupervised machine learning methods

Extensive experience with mathematical modeling/machine learning frameworks (Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Torch, OpenAI API, etc.)

Extensive experience of using automated testing and continuous integration frameworks

Extensive exposure to software product development and delivery practices and related tools

Expert knowledge of API design, component architectures, principles of service-oriented software

Mathematical optimization methods, gradient estimation, Bayesian Optimization

Parallel computing methods and frameworks

Preferred Qualifications

Familiarity with fundamental Modeling & Simulation principles and methods

Mathematical optimization methods

Numerical methods for solving partial differential equations problems

Interactive 3D graphics and data visualization

Distributed computing

GPU acceleration of numerical algorithms using CUDA/OpenCL

Amazon Web Services APIs

About us

Augmenta is an early stage startup founded by industry veterans and pioneers of novel design methods and technologies, building design automation tools that empower designers, engineers and planners to solve the most complex problems in their fields.

Starting with people’s goals & inspiration our systems use AI and computational techniques to explore thousands of possible designs - developing solutions that far outperform what anyone could create on their own. We're changing the way we fundamentally understand and solve problems with AI as our design partner.

Our goal is to create a world where the extremely difficult problems that face humankind are regularly solved through a completely new holistic way of thinking about and seeing the world, and a strong combination of artificial intelligence, simulation, strategy, empathy and human centered design.

Our vision is to be the place where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, to stay and do their best work. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, identity, orientation, age or disability.

Send a Resume and Cover letter to:
careers@augmenta.ai

Job Description
The Opportunity:

The Formulation Scientist is responsible for leading R&D efforts to develop new and innovative formulas and scale-up benchmark products including topical and semi-solid formulations using innovative technology. This position will serve as a technical expert in being a part of the concept to commercialization of products. Within a team environment, they bring new and unique ideas to the company, produce quality products, and deliver on ambitious goals.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES &TASKS
Develop and review specifications for new products for suitability within existing manufacturing systems
Recommend applicable testing based on product specification and written procedures
Optimize formulations to improve product cost and efficacy
Review and interpret analytical data related to all new and innovative products
Conducts patent searches to determine freedom to operate with a new formulation
Creates project timelines in accordance with marketing priorities, and sets milestones/critical path for project completion
Support with stability and production processes
Ability to evaluate technical issues and provide recommendations for corrective actions
Support product registration documentation and product chemistry packages to meet regulatory requirements
Assist and train co-workers, lab assistants and analysts as required
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Education & Experience
Ph.D (preferred) in chemistry or pharmaceutical technology
5+ years of practical work experience in formulation science
3+ years of experience leading new product formulations and customer evaluations.
Knowledge
Background in phytocannabinoids and lipophyllic compounds
Understanding of pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics when it comes to formulation development
Awareness of steps in a product application submission process
Familiarity of ISO and GMP regulations
Instrumentation
Excellent understanding and working knowledge of formulation and analytical instruments, not limited to chromatography (UPLC, HPLC, GC, TLC) and spectroscopic technologies (UV, IR) and Karl Fisher
WORK ENVIRONMENT
Laboratory environment with potential biohazards present
Contact with cannabis and cannabis products
CRITICAL COMPETENCIES FOR THIS ROLE
A creative and innovative thinker with data analysis and critical evaluation capabilities
A skilled project manager with a “hands-on” approach to getting the job done
A driven self-starter with intense attention to detail in a deadline-driven environment
A proven team player with superb written and oral communication skills.
Diteba is committed to providing accessible employment practices that follow the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Upon request, we will, in consultation with the applicant, determine the nature of any accommodation that may be required.
Company Description
Founded in 2004, Diteba was born out of a passion for uncovering and understanding complex scientific problems. Since our inception, we’ve helped hundreds of companies with testing and in navigating the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approval process. Our reputation is built not just on great analytical and bioanalytical testing, but on an unwavering commitment to helping our clients achieve their goals.

We push the boundaries of problem-solving while providing the highest standard of testing across the Pharmaceutical, Cannabis, Nutraceutical, and Food and Agriculture industries.

We’re on a mission to advance science-based innovation with a commitment to truth and transparency. We’re looking for incredible people, fueled by passion and curiosity, to be a part of our journey of growth – will you join us?

Location: Toronto- Canada
Job ID: 19WD33057

Position Overview
The User Interface Research Group at Autodesk Research is seeking exceptionally talented research scientists to work on cutting-edge Human-Computer Interaction research on the topic of Human Computer Interaction. This a broad topic area that could encompass research on many areas within user interface and interactions, including: software learning, data visualization and data understanding, AI HCI and intelligent user interfaces, AR/VR, novel interfaces and interactions, and tools for supporting collaborative work. Successful candidates will have a demonstrated track record of broadly recognized research results in leading conferences and publication venues (e.g., ACM CHI, UIST, IUI, CSCW, IEEE VR, VIS, ISMAR or similar).

The overall mission of the User Interface Research Group is to apply Human-Computer Interaction expertise to develop fundamental understandings of how humans perceive, learn, and interact with technology, and based on these understandings, to develop novel interfaces and visualizations to solve current problems, explore future opportunities, and influence Autodesk’s corporate strategy. A particular area of interest for our group is how the digital trails that humans leave as they interact with technology and the environment can be used to improve their future experiences.

Responsibilities
Conceive, plan, develop, and implement scientific research projects to advance scientific knowledge in business-relevant areas
Publish papers in peer-reviewed scientific journals/conferences
Supervise research interns (typically PhD students from top research universities)
Present research findings at conferences and participate in research collaborations with external research institutes and universities
Communicate and promote the use of research findings throughout Autodesk
Consult with product teams on the implementation of research findings into products
Generate intellectual property such as patents and trade-secrets from research findings
Manage and coordinate projects as they move from research prototype to shipping products or services
Minimum Qualifications
Ph.D. in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or other relevant disciplines, ideally on the topic of Human-Computer Interaction or a closely-related area
Demonstrated experience of HCI research fundamentals, including experience designing and evaluating novel interfaces and technologies
Strong history of publications in HCI or related fields
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to quickly learn new technologies and adapt to new situations
Ability to conduct quantitative and qualitative studies to evaluate concepts, designs, and systems
Ability to work collaboratively with people from many different disciplines (design, development, etc.)

Job Summary

Reporting to the Senior Manager Investment Data Management – Data Delivery, the Senior Business Data Analyst is responsible for providing first level trading application support to the Investment Management (IM) team. Applications supported include Bloomberg AIM, CanDeal, MarketAxess, Fenics, Tradeweb and PC Bond. The incumbent will manage relationships with IM and vendors to address production issues, co-ordinate training and execute on projects. End to end knowledge of trading workflows will be leveraged to build out a best in class trading platform support to IM.

The incumbent will also work as an integral part of the Investment Data Management (IDM) team to ensuring that investment applications have complete and accurate information for business users on a daily basis. This includes but is not limited to: ensuring data integrity and availability within Investment applications, data reconciliation, data quality, pricing integrity, security master maintenance, integrity of reference and market data, trade capture between and through investment applications. The Senior Business Data Analyst will design and implement data quality controls and assist with development of data governance best practices. They will develop processes and controls for the Investment Book of Record views that support Investment Management decision making. Furthermore, they will manage Data Vendors to support user’s data requests and ensure adherence to HOOPP’s vendor management framework.

The Senior Business Data Analyst will have strong analytical skills, strong work ethic, and sharp business acumen, coupled with experience in supporting trading platforms, managing investment data, investment operations, business and/or project management, and systems implementation. This position requires an above average, technically inclined individual who is a self-starter and highly motivated to manage financial data/systems. The individual must be able to work in a fast-paced environment and will be faced with tight timelines and critical deadlines. In addition, this individual will be an active participant who understands and is committed to team objectives.

Roles and Responsibilities
Provide full service first level support to Front Office users for their Vendor Based Trading Applications. This involves but is not limited to new application onboarding, application enhancements, managing configurations within the applications and troubleshooting issues that prevent trades from flowing to/from and through application.
Management of Bloomberg; onboarding users, management of terminals, data licensing, permission management, Bloomberg configurations to flow trades to and from platform.
Develop best practice standards and models for data governance and monitor adherence to the standards.
Execute, create and enhance data integrity reporting to assess potential data issues resident in the various Investment applications. Takes a proactive approach in updating and maintaining data under management and ensures that controls are in place to maintain this data on an ongoing basis.
Accountable for the design, development, and implementation of Data Quality checks using the Data Quality Tool. Actively seeks opportunities to create data synergies across HOOPP and to automate quality control and integrity checks, wherever possible. Proactively validates data using exception handling tools and procedures. Contributes to the development of these tools, and identify opportunities to leverage pre-existing tools to meet new business requirements.
When data exceptions are identified or have been escalated to the Senior Business Data Analyst, they will perform detailed business & data analysis to resolve data issues with vendors and HOOPP Investment business areas. The Senior Business Data Analyst will resolve breaks and not merely report them to other personnel for their resolutions.
Lead investment system release and or data recovery processes to meet SLA’s. Develop a detailed understanding of HOOPP’s investment business and the various systems and operation processes used to support it; respond quickly and accurately to questions and problems that arise in the availability, integrity or completeness of investment data.
Senior Business Data Analyst is responsible for the security master file, reference data, pricing and market data; consolidating multiple external data sources, comparing them and then creating a single version of master and reference data. Synchronizing positions and transactions in production systems. An objective is to minimize miscommunications between systems, in the first instance, such that data integrity and reconciliations tests are only required to prove that investment division data quality is excellent, reliable and timely. Define and develop processes for Investment Book of Records; these are Portfolios that provide unique views to Investment Management for their investment decision making and benchmarking.
Documenting data and content business requirements, business process methods and data flows including specifications for new integrity checks and enhancements.
Provides mentoring to colleagues within Investment Data Management Team to ensure support of new data requirements in the daily production environment.
Participate in the various phases of system development projects, including requirements definition, software selection, analysis/design, data conversion, testing and implementation with a focus on data integrity and controls.
Apply strong cross functional planning and coordination capabilities to coordinate and/or lead cross departmental efforts on behalf of Investment Data Management, often involving multiple stakeholders, cross functional dependencies. Data Vendor Management; procurement of new data sources, vendor due diligence, budget and forecasting and invoice management.
Development of Master Data Management technologies and processes that create ‘fit for purpose’ data from multiple sources.
Primary back up for Trade Desk Support Associates.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Minimum experience: 5 years in trading systems support or investment and financial systems administration, implementation and investment data management.
Post-secondary training in finance or equivalent experience. Completion of Canadian Securities Course. Enrolment or completion of relation professional training (e.g. CFA) – is not required though may be an asset.
Knowledge of investment management principles and practices with exposure to marketable securities, derivatives, private placements and real estate.
Highly analytical with strong consulting and problem-solving ability. Tenacity to identify the root cause of problems is essential.
Team player with excellent interpersonal and communication (written and verbal) skills are essential to deal with all levels of staff and outside contacts.
Comprehensive understanding of securities trading workflows and technologies.
Comprehensive understanding of middle and back office processes and technical applications.
An understanding of, and an ability to comprehend, the nature and workflows of a multi investment system environment and the data usage by various user groups.
An understanding of the accounting and performance responsibilities and reporting requirements will be an asset to this position.
Develop a strong proficiency with computer applications being utilized for the Investment business (SimCorp Dimension, Eagle PACE, SS&C Net, AIM, SAP HANA, SAP Data Services, Bloomberg, Vendor Based Front Office Trading Tools).
Understanding and/or previous experience using data quality tools and procedures. A thorough understanding of the interdependencies between relational database tables. Good understanding of report development concepts. Proficiency with MS SQL Server Tools, SQL language and/or Transact-SQL language, ETL Tools is a definite asset. Competence with database report writers, business intelligence tools and basic PC and Windows skills with a strong proficiency in Excel.
Solid knowledge of valuation pricing methodology across all asset classes.
Experience in data vendor management; contract negotiation, invoice reconciliation, vendor negotiation and evaluation.
Experience in Master Data Management.
Prior Business Analysis experience is an asset.
